awd_titl_txt: Parental Socialization of Preschoolers' Emotions: Modeling, Contingency, and Coaching
awd_abstract_narration: How is a preschooler's emotional expression socialized?  This                   research will investigate individual differences in pre-school                  children's expression and understanding of emotions.  Studies                   will explore parental socialization of emotions in 3 1/2 year old               children.  The planning grant will provide an opportunity to                    improve the methodology and test the feasibility of various                     measures of modeling, coaching, and contingency.  After the                     planning grant activity has been completed, there will be a                     follow-on proposal for a longitudinal, comprehensive test of a                  model predicting how socialization about emotions affects the                   young child's understanding and expression of emotions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
